column4: please, I made a full backup of my home directory before reinstall of ubuntu, and now I want to transfer it back to my home folder, could anyone help me with the correct "cp" command? to copy all the folders and subfolders and files (even the protected and invisible ones)?
well, you could use ctrl H to show the hidden files in nautilus if you have it mounted and are looking at it
and then just drag and drop, thats what I'd do
the thing is, I've done that and nautilus aparently doesn't deal well with a bunch of files, it copy most of the things, but it still misses other
